reviewsJson.markdown:
**Setup**

 *RDA*/ Velocity *Coil*/ 6 Wrap Single Fused Kanthal Clapton 2×26 core 32 wrap *W*/ 45 
*Wicking*/ Full Rayon *Ω*/0.26           

**Testing**        

*Steep Time*/3 weeks *% Used*/ 5     
*PG/VG* 50/50 *Nic%*/0    

**Mouth Feel** 

Heavy on the tongue and nose. Fairly dense I give it a 7/10

**Throat Hit**

 4/10 I'm assuming this is from the spice mixture.             

**Flavor Properties** 

Sweet red wine, spiced with clove a hint of cinnamon, a little anise, Ginger and citrus I'm assuming Orange. ( this could also just be the ginger it can take on citrus note depending on where it is grown )There is probably a little nutmeg in there as well considering that this is traditional but I'm not picking it up.    

**Relatable Flavors** 

This tastes like a sweet dessert wine with plenty of extras to give it character. 

**Position In The Recipe** 

Base or top note. This flavore should be easy to build on, and the spices are really going to take the top note in most recipes.

**Pairings** 

Most citrus fruits in particular tropical and orange will pair nicely, also thinking that a mint will really bring this flavoring to life. Should also play nicely with tobacco's and dessert flavorings such as cake.

**Recipe**

https://alltheflavors.com/recipes/7027

**Notes**

This is a pretty fantastic standalone flavoring with plenty of punch at 5%. Was hoping for more of a dark red wine not a big fan of sweet wines, may need to pick up something bitter to push it to that dry dark red wine place.           

http://www.vaperstek.org/mulled-wine-aroma-flavor/            
                            
**Rating** 85/100                

*Please if your opinion differs, or you have another review for this post it in the comments. Will help the master list with multiple reviews in one spot.*
reviewsJson.author: Chrisdvr1
reviewsJson.title: Mulled Wine
